title: 112_hr1979
content: ELIGIBILITY FOR PAYMENT OF BOTH RETIRED PAY AND VETERANS' DISABILITY COMPENSATION FOR CERTAIN MILITARY RETIREES WITH SERVICE-CONNECTED DISABILITIES. Extension of Concurrent Receipt Authority to Retirees With Service-Connected Disabilities Rated Less Than 50 Percent. Repeal of Phase-In of Concurrent Receipt of Retired Pay and Veterans' Disability Compensation. Clerical Amendments. Clerical amendments are made to section 1414 regarding members eligible for retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The section heading and table of sections are amended for clarity. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The amendments are effective from January 1, 2012, and apply to payments starting from that date. Additionally, there is coordination for combat-related special compensation and concurrent receipt of benefits. Amendments to eligibility for TERA retirees under title 10, United States Code, now specify criteria for retired pay entitlement. Standardization changes include clerical and conforming amendments to align similar provisions. Amendments to Section 1414 of title 10, United States Code, define a "qualified retiree" as a former member of the uniformed services entitled to both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Amendments to Section 1414 of title 10, United States Code, define a "qualified retiree" as a former member entitled to retired pay and veterans' disability compensation, with specific rules for chapter 61 disability retirees. The amendments made to Section 1414 of title 10, United States Code, define a "qualified retiree" as a former member entitled to retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Retired pay of chapter 61 disability retirees is subject to changes, with the effective date set for January 1, 2012. Repeal of requirement to reduce SBP survivor annuities by dependency and indemnity compensation. Repeal of subsections in chapter 73 of title 10, United States Code, including changes to sections 1450 and 1451. Conforming amendments made to subsections in section 1450 and 1451, as well as section 1452. The text discusses the repeal of certain subsections in chapter 73 of title 10, United States Code, with changes to sections 1450 and 1451. It also includes a prohibition on retroactive benefits and recoupment of certain amounts previously refunded to SBP recipients. The text discusses the restoration of annuity eligibility for previously eligible spouses who elected to transfer payment under specific provisions of title 10, United States Code. The effective date for this section and its amendments is either October 1, 2011, or the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. ELIMINATION OF FISCAL YEAR LIMITATION IN CONSIDERING ACTIVE DUTY AND ACTIVE SERVICE FOR EARLY ELIGIBILITY FOR RECEIPT OF NON-REGULAR SERVICE RETIRED PAY. The amendment allows individuals below 60 years of age to receive retired pay for each aggregate of 90 days of active duty or active service performed after January 28, 2008.
